items.sentence: I wanted to eat lunch with you, but I had to take me son to the hospital.
I'm not the one who took care of Tom when his mother was in the hospital.
I'd like to come to your party, but unfortunately I have to be in Boston.
Is there anything you've wanted to do recently, but haven't been able to?
We have to do everything on this list, but not necessarily in this order.
The population of Tokyo is about five times as large as that of our city.
Tom's parents said that they wouldn't let him go to Australia by himself.
Not very many students could answer the questions that the teacher asked.
I didn't think Tom would be interested in buying any of Mary's paintings.
Be selective in your battles. Sometimes peace is better than being right.
